tests.paragraph: The first-ever comprehensive assessment of net population changes in the U.S. and Canada reveals across-the-board declines that scientists call "staggering." All told, the North American bird population is down by 3 billion breeding adults, with devastating losses among birds in every biome. 30% of the total American bird population has been lost.
tests.anki_card: In the U.S. and Canada, the North American bird population has decreased by {{c1::3 billion breeding adults}}, with a {{c2::30%}} loss of the total American bird population.
